summary: Email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorneys regarding the Epstein case, discussing whether Epstein has responded to something and the PDF'ing of responses. Shows internal DOJ communication about the case in December 2007.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Referenced in email subject lines and body, with attorneys inquiring whether he has responded to something.

connections.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney is inquiring about whether Epstein has responded to something, indicating a prosecutorial interest.

events.title: Inquiry about Epstein response
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails asking if Epstein has responded and if they should do anything.

events.title: PDF'ing responses
events.description: An attorney states they are PDF'ing 'their responses', likely related to the Epstein case.

keyFacts: Internal DOJ email correspondence about Jeffrey Epstein from December 2007.
Assistant U.S. Attorneys are discussing whether Epstein has responded to something.
One attorney mentions 'PDF'ing their responses', indicating document preparation related to the case.
The correspondence shows ongoing legal activity regarding Epstein in late 2007.
